description.narrative: Advocacy and Communication, which contributes to Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Effectively plan, monitor, evaluate and report on programme delivery.

title.narrative: Pakistan United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Programmes in Pakistan (Emergencies Disaster Risk Reduction)
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
2019 Pakistan: Reach Every District (RED)/Reach Every Community (REC) Strategy Evaluation Pakistan (2014-18)
Pakistan 2020 Annual Report on Results for Children
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: UNICEF obtained the issuance of a commemorative stamp; lit up 21 landmark buildings across Pakistan in blue and produced a video message on child rights read out by the President of Pakistan to celebrate CRC@30. UNICEF released 11 videos, 20 stories, 15 press statements and eight op-eds, and organized media visits in support of child rights. Contents on social media platforms, including in Urdu resulted in increased number of followers on Facebook (20 per cent, to 333,000 followers), Twitter (30 per cent, to 52,000 followers), and Instagram ( 650 per cent, to 13,000 followers), reaching more than 29 million people | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of Human Interest Stories featuring UNICEF's regular and humanitarian interventions and key issues pertaining to children in Pakistan produced and shared with donors, published on UNICEF PCO website and social media
Number of users on UNICEF websites and blogs
Number of people reached on UNICEF social media channels
